50627.body: A fun read that I used to find some great new music on Napster. Badly Drawn Boy is my new favorite band thanks to Hornby. The more I read of his stuff, the more I think he'd be a fun bloke to have a pint or two with.

50658.body: read this while i was laying out in thailand. it was fun at the time. i can't guarantee i'll feel the same way now...

50661.body: The book is known to be the sequel of "The Gone with the Wind" by Margarette Mitchel. However, except for some parts, it has failed to serve as a decent sequel to the magnificent original work. It is more a new age light novel instead.

50666.recommended_for: People interested in other countries and cultures
50666.body: While the book is classified as travel memoir, it also deals with the religious dabbling of the author during the time that she lived in India. Funny and enlightening (no pun intended).

50667.recommended_for: People who love quirky, real stories
50667.body: I picked this book up thinking it would be reminiscent of Northern Exposure--a show I love. While it does have the same quirky, intelligent humor with heart, it also deals with the spiritual aspects of death in a touching, cathartic way. Highly recommended.

50672.body: this was one of the hardest books to get through for me. what could have been a fun read turned into a jumbled politically driven mess. maybe i just don't have the imagination for it, but i really didn't care for this book. it didn't even get rewarding near the end, it was just non stop unnecessa...

50673.body: i probably wouldn't recommend watching the movie before reading the book, which is what i did. i still enjoyed it, though.

50676.recommended_for: Lovers of literature and travel books
50676.body: A professor of literature who focuses on the moderns (Joyce, Lawrence, Woolf) relates his travels from Alberta, Canada to Austin, Texas on his Ducati. Along the way he muses about the connection of his two loves--literature and motorcycles. Fun read.

50713.body: این اثر بزرگ جویس در زبان فارسی سرنوشت عجیبی داشته. بار اول تکه هایی از آن توسط ابوالحسن نجفی ترجمه شده و اگر درست بخاطر داشته باشم در کتاب هفته به چاپ رسیده است. بعدها دیگری که نامش را بخاطر ندارم، دست به ترجمه ی اولیس زد که اتفاقی نیفتاد. گویا ربیعی اولیس را بصورت کامل ترجمه کرده و بعدن در ممیز...

50715.body: با نام "سیمای مرد هنرآفرین در جوانی" توسط پرویز داریوش به فارسی برگردانده شده و نشر اساطیر آن را در 1370 منتشر کرده است. گفته می شود منوچهر بدیعی هم این اثر جویس را با نام "چهره ی هنرمند در جوانی" ترجمه کرده که اجازه ی چاپ نیافته است!

50718.body: این اثر جویس را احمد گلشیری با نام "مردگان" ترجمه کرده که در جلد دوم "داستان و نقد داستان" منتشر شده است.
